job_tasks.phrase: You'll combine your technological expertise, domain knowledge, and an unquestionable dedication to business objectives
job_tasks.justification: This phrase explicitly mentions dedication to business objectives and combining technical expertise with domain knowledge, indicating an understanding of the business context.

job_tasks.phrase: By that time you will be able to understand the business value of our products and features, and the needs of our customers
job_tasks.justification: This directly states the requirement to comprehend the business value of products and customer needs.

job_tasks.phrase: And you are able to translate feature requests into simple, but robust engineering (or non-engineering) solutions
job_tasks.justification: This indicates the ability to take business-level requests (feature requests) and translate them into actionable solutions, which is a core aspect of business understanding.

job_tasks.phrase: build delightful features and products for our community, as well as the thousands of companies who trust HackerOne with their cybersecurity posture.
job_tasks.justification: This describes the core activity of building features and products, which falls under software development.
This implies the setup and use of development tools, a precursor to software development.

job_tasks.phrase: get to learn the technology stack (Ruby on Rails + GraphQL + ReactJS + many more)
job_tasks.justification: Learning a technology stack is essential for performing software development tasks.

job_tasks.phrase: have committed a bunch of code to our repositories
job_tasks.justification: Committing code to repositories is a direct activity in software development.

job_tasks.phrase: start developing a knack for being a fast and effective software engineer on our codebase
job_tasks.justification: This explicitly mentions being a software engineer and working on a codebase.

job_tasks.phrase: lead your first project as Software Engineer
job_tasks.justification: Leading a project as a Software Engineer is a clear indication of software development responsibilities.

job_tasks.phrase: translate feature requests into simple, but robust engineering (or non-engineering) solutions
job_tasks.justification: Translating feature requests into engineering solutions is a key software development task.

job_tasks.phrase: identify and make systematic improvements to technical weaknesses you'll find in your squad's codebases, and in shared codebases across the company.
job_tasks.justification: Systematic improvements to technical weaknesses in codebases implies a focus on code quality and maintenance, which aligns with operations and improving the overall engineering system.

job_tasks.phrase: work with the seniors of the team, and with Product Managers and Designers
You are a collaborative and effective software engineer and team member.
You will interact with CSM's, who are the voice of our customers.
you will have branched out and talked to Sales, Marketing and various other functions, and developed a good sense of cross-functional collaboration and communication
identify and make systematic improvements to technical weaknesses you'll find in your squad's codebases
translate feature requests into simple, but robust engineering (or non-engineering) solutions
guide and coach the more junior IC's.
lead your first project as Software Engineer

you will have branched out and talked to Sales, Marketing and various other functions, and developed a good sense of cross-functional collaboration and communication

lead your first project as Software Engineer

classification.rationale: This job description focuses heavily on traditional software development tasks and collaboration, with no mention of AI, machine learning, generative models, or related technologies. The primary responsibilities are building features, working with a tech stack (Ruby on Rails, GraphQL, ReactJS), and cross-functional communication, which are characteristic of a general Software Engineer role, not an ML or GenAI Engineer.
